name: Tweenies: Doodles' Bones
overview: Tweenies: Doodles' Bones is an action game developed by Tiertex Design Studios and published by BBC Multimedia for the Game Boy Color in 2001. The game is one of two games to be based on the BBC children's television show: Tweenies, a live action, pre-school show that first ran from September 1999 to July 2002 on CBBC and later CBeebies. The other game is "Tweenies: Game Time", which was also released on the same year as this game, but for the PlayStation. It consists of 9 minigames, four games are respective to the four main characters: - Bella's game requires you to collect bananas from the Jungle whilst avoiding spiders. - Fizz's game requires you to water flowers whilst avoiding ghosts. - Milo's game requires you to collect coloured ties whilst avoiding pies being thrown at you. - Jake's game requires you to collect shells whilst avoiding clams. The other five are respective to the different modes on the Tweenie Clock: - Song time: A Simon-says type game. Repeat the tune you hear. - Story time: Fill in the missing pieces of the pictures. - Messy time: Help Jake drop the color balls in the matching colored bins. - Telly time: Match the pictures with the picture on the Telly - News Time: Guide Doodles around the garden and help him find his bones. As the game progresses, you will collect map pieces that will help you find the bones!
